item.title: Joni add a quote by Lisa See
item.description: "The greatest calling of all is to have a literary life." -- Lisa See

item.title: Joni add a quote by Lisa See
item.description: "All women on earth-- and men, too for that matter-- hope for the kind of love that transforms us, raises us up out of the everyday, & gives us the courage to survive our little deaths: the heartache of unfulfilled dreams, of career and personal disappointments, of broken love affairs." -- Lisa See

item.title: Joni add a quote by Paula McLain
item.description: "He was such an enigma, really - fierce and strong and weak and cruel. An incomparable friend and a son of a bitch. In the end, there wasn't one thing about him that was truer than the rest. It was all true." -- Paula McLain

item.title: Joni add a quote by Mary Beth Chapman
item.description: "Everything, including our pain, is His. I am thankful He will meet me in it." -- Mary Beth Chapman

item.title: Joni add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind." -- Geraldine Brooks

item.title: Joni add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description:
"I falter where I firmly trod, And falling with my weight of cares Upon the great world's altar-stairs That slope thro' darkness up to God,
I stretch lame hands of faith, and grope, And gather dust and chaff, and call To what I feel is Lord of all, And faintly trust the larger hope." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Joni add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Joni add a quote by Daphne Kalotay
item.description: "How lucky Drew was to have this mother of hers, this constant, reliable, if at times irritating presence in her life--this mother, like so many other mothers, beloved and blamed. Lucky she was to have experience, through her mother, the twisted intricaciesof deep, and deeply complex, love." -- Daphne Kalotay

item.title: Joni add a quote by Susan Meissner
item.description: "I used to think mercy meant showing kindness to someone who didn't deserve it, as if only the recipient defined the act. The girl in between has learned that mercy is defined by its giver. Our flaws are obvious, yet we are loved and able t love, if we choose, because there is that bit of the divine still smoldering in us." -- Susan Meissner

item.title: Joni add a quote by Susan Meissner
item.description: "Dissecting a book was the same as making sense of life. You have to find a way to interpret life, or you'll go nuts." -- Susan Meissner

item.title: Joni add a quote by Susan Meissner
item.description: "Papa said marriage is not kept by affection but by a pledge. Affection does not beget the pledge; the pledge begets the affection. When you share a life and a home and a bed with someone, you become soul mates as surely as cream and effort produce butter....And so I began to imagine my life with James Luddy. I imagined being butter." -- Susan Meissner

item.title: Joni add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "At sunset, if I am near the water - and it is hard to be very far from it here -I pause to watch the splendid disc set the brine aflame and then douse itself in it's own fiery broth." -- Geraldine Brooks

item.title: Joni add a quote by Geraldine Brooks
item.description: "He walked through the woods like a young Adam, naming creation." -- Geraldine Brooks
